item.title: Decryption Originalism: The Lessons of Burr
item.description: Authors: Kerr, Orin Published: February 2020 URL: https://papers.ssrn.com/abstract=3533069 Tags: 2020s Amendment V Amendment V / Self Incrimination Mobile Abstract: The Supreme Court is likely to rule soon on how the Fifth Amendment privilege against self-incrimination applies to compelled decryption of a digital device. When the Court rules, the original understanding of the Fifth Amendment may control the outcome. This Article details an extraordinary case that illuminates the original understanding of the privilege and its application to compelled decryption.
